title: Cyclone Fani Landfall Confirmed
text: Official IMD reports confirm Cyclone Fani made landfall near Puri, Odisha on 3 May 2019 with severe wind impact.

title: Viral Video Misattributed to Cyclone Fani
text: A viral video claiming to show Cyclone Fani was debunked by AFP and TheQuint; the footage was from an unrelated storm.

title: OSDMA Documents Mass Evacuations During Fani
text: State disaster reports show large-scale evacuation and staged relief before Cyclone Fani.

title: False Claim About Permanent Power Loss in Puri
text: Rumors alleging permanent destruction of power lines in Puri after Fani were denied by state utilities.

title: 1999 Odisha Super Cyclone Casualties Verified
text: Historical disaster records confirm nearly 10,000 deaths in the 1999 Odisha super cyclone.

title: Fake US Billboard Supporting Odisha During Fani
text: Images claiming US billboards supported Odisha during Fani were found to be digitally edited.

title: Cyclone Hudhud Impact on Odisha Confirmed
text: Cyclone Hudhud (2014) caused evacuations and at least two deaths in Odisha.

title: Cyclone Dana Viral Video Debunked
text: A misleading video claiming to show Cyclone Dana damage was proven to be old footage.

title: Cyclone Phailin Impact Verified
text: Cyclone Phailin made landfall near Gopalpur causing massive evacuations and damage.

title: Dangerous Fake Advisory During Cyclone Fani
text: A viral message incorrectly advised residents to break windows during the cyclone; NDRF debunked it.

title: Cyclone Titli Landslide Impact Confirmed
text: Cyclone Titli (2018) triggered landslides and severe damage in coastal districts.

title: Train Accident Image Miscaptioned
text: An ISKCON temple was miscaptioned as a mosque near an Odisha train accident site to fuel tensions.

title: OSDMA Publishes District-Wise Preparedness Reports
text: OSDMA regularly publishes cyclone preparedness and shelter readiness reports.

title: Edited Video Shared as Real Evacuation Order
text: A training exercise video was falsely shared as a real emergency announcement.

title: Fishermen Advised to Stay Ashore During Cyclone
text: IMD advisories encouraged Odisha fishermen to stay ashore, reducing casualties.

title: False Claim About Relief Funds Diversion
text: Viral posts claimed Odisha relief funds were diverted; audits did not support this.

title: Cyclone Dana Impact Confirmed by AP News
text: Verified reports show Cyclone Dana affected Odisha, but many viral videos were fake.

title: False Claim of 5m Sea Rise at Puri
text: IMD tide data showed no evidence of a 5m sea-level rise during recent storms.

title: Cyclone Fani Fatality Count Verified
text: Official sources confirm over 60 deaths in Odisha due to Cyclone Fani.

title: Misleading Water Safety Advisory
text: A viral statewide boil-water order was misleading; only local advisories were issued.

title: Satellite Imagery Confirms Erosion After Storms
text: Remote sensing data confirmed coastline erosion after major storms in Odisha.

title: Unverified Claims About Fish Deaths After Storm
text: Viral claims blamed chemical dumping for fish deaths; investigations were inconclusive.

title: OSDMA Releases Cyclone Shelter Data
text: Odisha publishes district-wise cyclone shelter and evacuation reports.

title: False Claim That Bridges Collapsed Before Cyclone
text: Engineering assessments show collapses occurred due to storm impact, not before.

title: Odisha Flash Floods Confirmed in Monsoon Season
text: Reports confirmed flash flooding in low-lying regions during the 2018â€“2019 monsoons.

title: Monsoon Storms Cause Property Damage in Coastal Odisha
text: Seasonal monsoon storms brought heavy rainfall and localized flooding, damaging homes in coastal Odisha districts.

title: False Rumor of Tsunami Warning After Minor Tremor
text: A viral message falsely claimed that an earthquake near Odisha triggered a tsunami alert; official agencies issued no such warning.

title: Odisha Heatwave Alert Officially Issued
text: IMD issued a severe heatwave alert for interior Odisha districts during peak summer.

title: Fake Video Claims to Show Flood in Cuttack
text: A video alleging catastrophic flooding in Cuttack was debunked as old footage from another state.

title: Fishermen Rescued After Cyclone Winds Hit Coast
text: NDRF teams rescued multiple fishermen stranded at sea during sudden cyclone-related wind intensification.

title: Unverified Claim of Crocodile Sightings in Flooded Streets
text: Viral claims of crocodiles roaming urban Odisha streets during floods were not confirmed by authorities.

title: Government Confirms Relief Camps Open Across Odisha
text: Official statements reported the opening of multiple relief camps in flood-affected districts.

title: False Claim That Cyclone Blew Away Entire Village
text: Images circulated claiming a whole Odisha village was blown away by cyclone winds; officials denied total destruction.

title: Cyclone Shelters Successfully Withstood Storm Winds
text: Structural inspections after the cyclone confirmed that all designated cyclone shelters remained safe.

title: Misleading Photo Shared as Lightning Strike After Cyclone
text: A dramatic photo of lightning was miscaptioned as 'taken during cyclone aftermath' but was stock photography.

title: OSDMA Deploys Rapid Response Teams
text: OSDMA confirmed rapid response teams were deployed to high-risk coastal blocks before landfall.

title: Fake Video Claims Roads Split Open Due to Cyclone
text: A viral video of cracked roads was traced to an old earthquake event, not a recent cyclone in Odisha.

title: Heavy Rainfall Breaks Local Records
text: Meteorological data shows that certain Odisha districts recorded the highest rainfall in two decades.

title: Rumors Claim Wildlife Escaped From Zoo After Storm
text: Authorities clarified that no animals escaped from Nandankanan Zoo despite viral rumors.

title: Cyclone-Damaged Roads Block Emergency Travel
text: Multiple key roads were confirmed blocked due to fallen trees and flooding during cyclone impact.

title: Unverified Claim That Dams Were Secretly Opened
text: Messages alleging unannounced dam water release were not supported by official dam management records.

title: NDRF Confirms Successful Evacuation Operations
text: Rescue teams evacuated thousands of residents from flood-prone areas before water levels rose.

title: Fake Image of Flyover Collapse Goes Viral
text: An image claiming a flyover collapsed in Odisha during the storm was found to be from another country.

title: Odisha Records Zero Casualties Due to Early Evacuation
text: Due to effective early warnings, some districts reported zero casualties during recent cyclones.

title: False Rumor That Schools Collapsed in Jagatsinghpur
text: Authorities confirmed all school buildings remained structurally safe despite viral claims.

title: Cyclone Winds Uproot Thousands of Trees
text: Forest officials confirmed large-scale uprooting of trees during cyclonic landfall.

title: Fake Message Claims Mobile Networks Shutdown Statewide
text: Telecom operators denied statewide shutdown; only localized outages occurred.

title: Odisha Govt Confirms Food Supply to Relief Shelters
text: Daily meals were supplied to all major relief shelters during flood operations.

title: Misleading Claim of Snake Infestation After Floods
text: Authorities found no evidence of abnormal snake presence despite viral claims.

title: Odisha Health Dept Confirms No Disease Outbreak
text: Health officials reported no epidemic outbreaks after recent flooding.

title: Floodwater Enters Low-Lying Villages in Kendrapara
text: Continuous rainfall caused floodwater to enter several low-lying villages in Kendrapara district.

title: False Claim of Crocodile Attack During Floods
text: Rumors of crocodile attacks during Odisha floods were denied by forest department officials.

title: IMD Issues Red Alert for Heavy Rainfall
text: The Indian Meteorological Department issued a red alert for torrential rainfall in southern Odisha.

title: Misleading Photo Shared as Odisha Flood Evacuation
text: A photo circulated as an Odisha flood evacuation was actually from Bangladesh.

title: NDRF Rescues Elderly Residents in Flooded Areas
text: The NDRF successfully evacuated elderly residents stranded by rising waters.

title: Fake Video Claims Bhubaneswar Airport Is Underwater
text: Authorities clarified that the viral video was unrelated and the airport remained operational.

title: Odisha Govt Provides Compensation to Affected Farmers
text: The state government announced financial assistance for crop losses due to flooding.

title: False Alert Claims Cyclone Will Hit Within 24 Hours
text: IMD confirmed no cyclone was forming despite viral panic messages.

title: Storm Damages Electricity Poles Across Coastal Regions
text: Strong winds damaged numerous electric poles, causing temporary outages.

title: Fake Claim That Entire District Was Evacuated
text: Officials denied claims that an entire district had been fully evacuated before landfall.

title: IMD Issues Cyclone Tracking Bulletins
text: Regular cyclone bulletins were issued to track storm movement accurately.

title: False Rumor of Breakwater Collapse in Paradip
text: Authorities inspected the Paradip port breakwater and found no structural failure.

title: Odisha Opens Temporary Medical Camps
text: Health authorities set up temporary medical camps for flood-affected residents.

title: Fake Video Claims Tornado Hit Odisha
text: A video falsely claiming a tornado struck Odisha was traced to a different country.

title: Villagers Use Boats for Safe Evacuation
text: Rescue teams provided boats to evacuate villagers stranded by rising waters.

title: False Claim That Relief Trucks Never Reached Villages
text: Inspection reports confirmed relief trucks reached all designated locations.

title: Water Levels in Major Rivers Rising
text: IMD and water resources data show major rivers nearing danger levels.

title: False Message Predicts Earthquake After Cyclone
text: Viral messages predicting an earthquake after the cyclone were baseless.

title: Residents Shift to Elevated Shelters
text: Thousands moved to elevated cyclone shelters ahead of expected flooding.

title: Fake Claim That Reservoir Burst After Heavy Rains
text: Officials denied reports that a reservoir burst; the structure was intact.

title: Heavy Winds Damage Agricultural Fields
text: Cyclone winds damaged paddy and vegetable crops across multiple blocks.

title: False Rumor of Wild Elephants Entering Towns
text: Forest authorities confirmed no elephant movement in towns despite viral claims.

title: Odisha Police Ensure Safe Evacuation Process
text: Police forces assisted vulnerable populations in reaching safe shelters.

title: Fake Image Shows Collapsed School Building
text: A photo claiming a school collapsed in Odisha was found to be from Nepal.

title: Cyclone Causes Major Storm Surge in Coastal Areas
text: Storm surge inundated several coastal blocks, prompting urgent evacuation.

title: Fake Video Claims Volcano Erupted in Odisha
text: A viral video claiming 'volcanic eruption in Odisha' was entirely fabricated.

title: Odisha Govt Ensures Drinking Water Supply
text: Tanker services were deployed to provide drinking water in affected villages.

title: Misleading Map Shows Fake Flood Zones
text: A viral map showing large flooded zones was digitally altered.

title: Cyclone-Damaged Bridges Being Repaired
text: Public works departments began repairing damaged bridges after the cyclone.

title: Fake Claim of Poisonous Gas Leak After Storm
text: Authorities confirmed no gas leaks occurred despite viral misinformation.

title: Fishermen Warned to Avoid Deep Sea
text: IMD issued clear warnings advising fishermen to stay away from deep-sea zones.

title: Fake WhatsApp Message Predicts Second Cyclone
text: A viral message predicting a 'second cyclone within 48 hours' was baseless.

title: Evacuated Families Receive Relief Materials
text: State agencies distributed food, water, and essentials to evacuated families.

title: Fake Photo of Floating Cars Circulates
text: A viral image showing cars floating on a flooded road was found to be from China.

title: Cyclone Weakens After Landfall
text: IMD confirmed that the cyclone gradually weakened after making landfall.

title: False Claim That AIIMS Bhubaneswar Was Flooded
text: Authorities confirmed that viral images of a flooded AIIMS campus were fake.

title: People Shift to Higher Ground as Water Rises
text: Residents moved to higher ground as rivers approached danger level.

title: Fake Advisory Claims Wildfire Risk After Cyclone
text: Fake warnings of a 'wildfire risk due to cyclone effects' were debunked.

title: Odisha Fire Services Clear Fallen Trees
text: Fire service teams worked continuously to clear roads blocked by fallen trees.

title: Fake Voice Note Claims Entire Coast Will Submerge
text: A viral voice note falsely claimed Odisha's entire coastline would be underwater.

title: State Confirms Restoration of Power Supply
text: Electricity restoration work began within hours of cyclone slowdown.

title: Fake Claim Says Animals Predicted Upcoming Storm
text: No scientific evidence supports claims that animal behavior predicted the storm.

title: Relief Camps Provide Clean Drinking Water
text: Authorities ensured safe drinking water was available to all evacuees.

title: Fake Image Shows Helicopter Crash After Cyclone
text: An image of a helicopter crash circulated as 'from Odisha' was from Brazil.

title: Water Levels Drop After Controlled Dam Release
text: Officials confirmed water levels eased after controlled release from reservoirs.

title: False Message Warns of Airborne Disease Spread
text: A forward claiming cyclone winds carried airborne diseases was dismissed by health officials.

title: NGOs Distribute Relief Packages
text: Local NGOs distributed food and essential supplies to flood-affected families.

title: Fake Photo Claims Odisha Highway Was Destroyed
text: The viral photo of a destroyed highway was from a different country.

title: Meteorologists Confirm Storm Intensification
text: Satellite data showed intensifying cloud bands indicating storm strengthening.

title: Fake Message Warns of 'Black Rainfall' After Cyclone
text: A viral message predicting toxic black rain was debunked as misinformation.

title: Cyclone Shelters Reach Maximum Capacity
text: Thousands of residents took refuge in cyclone shelters as winds intensified.

title: Fake Claim of Snake Rain Circulating
text: A bizarre viral claim that snakes 'rained from the sky' during the storm was debunked.

title: Rapid Response Teams Clear Major Highways
text: Emergency teams cleared debris from national highways to restore connectivity.

title: Fake Video Claims Boats Capsized Due to Cyclone
text: A capsizing video linked to Odisha was from a Southeast Asian country.

title: Medical Teams Deployed to Remote Villages
text: Doctors and paramedics reached remote flood-hit areas to provide care.

title: False Rumor Says River Changed Course
text: Geological experts denied claims that the river changed its course overnight.

title: Livestock Evacuated Ahead of Cyclone
text: Farmers moved livestock to elevated safe zones before heavy rainfall.

title: Fake Image Shows Giant Waves in Puri
text: A viral image claiming enormous tidal waves near Puri was photoshopped.

title: State Confirms All Major Dams Are Safe
text: Structural inspections showed no safety issues in major Odisha dams.

title: Fake Claim Predicts 300 km/hr Winds
text: IMD denied viral predictions of unrealistic wind speeds.

title: NDRF Saves Children Trapped in Flooded House
text: NDRF teams rescued children trapped inside a flooded home in rural Odisha.

title: False Image Claims School Turned Into Lake
text: A viral image of a submerged school was traced to Thailand.

title: Electricity Restored in Major Towns
text: Repair teams restored power in towns affected by storm winds.

title: Fake Audio Clip Claims Bridges Are Collapsing
text: A viral audio clip warning of collapsing bridges was baseless.

title: Odisha Govt Ensures Free Food Distribution
text: Authorities provided cooked meals to displaced residents.

title: False Rumor That Cyclone Created Sinkholes
text: Experts denied claims that the cyclone created large sinkholes in Bhubaneswar.

title: Forest Teams Rescue Injured Animals
text: Forest officials rescued injured birds and animals after storm impact.

title: Fake Claim Says Railway Tracks Were Washed Away
text: Railway authorities confirmed tracks were intact despite viral claims.

title: Cyclone Affected Over 1 Million Residents
text: Government reports confirmed widespread cyclone impact across coastal districts.

title: False Prediction of 'Super Cyclone' Was Circulated
text: A message falsely claiming a 'super cyclone' would strike next week was debunked.

title: Shelter Volunteers Provide Blankets and Water
text: Volunteers distributed blankets and drinking water to shelter residents.

title: Fake Image Shows Coastline Split in Half
text: Satellite experts identified the viral image as digitally manipulated.

title: Water Tankers Deployed to Drought-Hit Areas
text: Tankers were sent to supply drinking water during drought-like conditions.

title: False Claim That Snakes Filled Entire Paddy Field
text: Forest rangers confirmed no unusual snake concentration in paddy fields.

title: Cyclone Brings Record-Breaking Wind Speeds
text: IMD confirmed wind speeds that broke regional records during landfall.

title: Fake Claim Says Meteor Hit Odisha Coast
text: No meteor impact occurred; the circulating footage was from Indonesia.

title: Cyclone Causes Major Power Outages
text: Several districts experienced long power outages due to fallen transmission lines.

title: False Video Claims Storm Lifted Cars Into Air
text: The video, said to be from Odisha, was from a European windstorm.

title: Landslide Blocks Roads in Hilly Regions
text: Heavy rainfall triggered landslides blocking access to several villages.

title: Fake Message Claims Drinking Water Is Contaminated Statewide
text: Officials confirmed contamination was localized, not statewide.

title: Cyclone Floods Thousands of Homes
text: Widespread flooding damaged thousands of homes along the coast.

title: Fake Image Shows Burning Forest Due to Cyclone
text: The viral image of burning forest was from California, not Odisha.

title: Rescue Teams Provide Emergency Medical Aid
text: Medical teams assisted injured residents in temporary shelters.

title: Fake Claim Says Odisha Will Face 10 More Cyclones
text: Meteorological departments rejected such exaggerated predictions.

title: Cyclone Weakening Trends Observed
text: Meteorologists observed weakening cloud structures after landfall.

title: Fake Photo Shows Cracked Earth Due to Cyclone
text: This cracked-earth image was from a drought-hit region in Africa.

title: Helicopter Teams Airlift Stranded Residents
text: Air rescue operations evacuated stranded villagers in remote areas.

title: Fake Rumor Claims Cyclone Triggered Earthquake
text: Experts confirmed no link between the cyclone and regional seismic activity.

title: Odisha Govt Announces Rehabilitation Packages
text: Financial rehabilitation packages were announced for affected families.

title: Fake Claim of Alien Sightings After Cyclone
text: A viral 'alien sighting' video was debunked as CGI animation.

title: Cyclone Causes Coastal Soil Erosion
text: Erosion was recorded along multiple coastline segments in Odisha.

title: Fake Map Predicts Odisha Submerging by 2030
text: The viral map was scientifically inaccurate and digitally altered.

title: District Hospitals Treat Flood-Related Injuries
text: Hospitals reported treating dozens of residents affected by debris and falls.

title: Fake Audio Claims 'Cyclone Will Reappear'
text: A misleading audio clip predicted the storm would return, which IMD denied.

title: NGOs Provide Psychological Support to Survivors
text: NGOs deployed counselors to help storm-affected families recover emotionally.

title: Fake Claim Says Reservoir Water Turned Black
text: Authorities confirmed water remained safe despite viral edited photos.

title: Cyclone Affected Power Grids Repaired
text: Engineers restored power grids damaged by strong winds.

title: Fake Storm Footage Shared as Odisha Disaster
text: A storm video labeled 'Odisha cyclone disaster' was from the Philippines.

title: Cyclone Emergency Funds Released
text: The state government released emergency funds for rapid cyclone relief.

title: Fake Claim Says Odisha Will Have Permanent Darkness
text: A bizarre fake claim said clouds would block the sun for weeks; authorities dismissed it.
